term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - metastability of a phase
term.title: metastability

item.text: A term that describes the state of a phase in which an energy barrier considerably higher than k.T must be surmounted before this phase can transform to a phase of lower molar Gibbs energy and molar Helmholtz energy, where k is the Boltzmann constant and T the thermodynamic temperature.

notes.item: In a thermodynamic sense, the equilibrium state is the state with the lowest molar Gibbs energy; a metastable state corresponds to a relative minimum in the molar Gibbs energy.

sources.item: PAC, 1994, 66, 577. 'Definitions of terms relating to phase transitions of the solid state (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' on page 586 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199466030577)
